intro: Obione ameghinoi, commonly known as the Argentine dwarf lily, is a rare and endemic flowering plant native to the Patagonian region of Argentina. It belongs to the Alstroemeriaceae family and is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces delicate, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink, typically blooming in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Obione ameghinoi is considered a vulnerable species.
